intro: Cleome pedunculata, commonly known as the spider flower, is a herbaceous annual plant native to the southeastern United States. It features showy, spider-like flowers that range in color from white to pink and are borne on long, slender peduncles. The plant has alternate, lance-shaped leaves with hairy surfaces, and its stems are often hairy as well. It thrives in full sun and well-drained soil, often found in disturbed areas such as roadsides and fields. Cleome pedunculata is valued in gardens for its ornamental value and ability to attract pollinators.
